source.title: The human brain is intrinsically organized into dynamic, anticorrelated functional networks

confidence_rationale: Strong foundational evidence for antagonistic large-scale networks supports regime-like mode interpretation.

mapping.source_claim_statement: Default-mode and task-positive systems show robust intrinsic anticorrelation in functional organization.
mapping.ree_translation: Supports ARC-016 expectation that control regimes can bias mutually competitive network configurations.
mapping.mapping_caveat: Anticorrelation strength depends on preprocessing and does not alone specify causal switching or policy-level control logic.

confidence_components.notes: Foundational but indirect relative to full REE architecture.
